text: Any elaboration or?
The child tables aren't working because it creates pages I don't want it to, and if I disable the automatic child page creation then the 3rd level page 404's
Hey, does anybody know what `object_type` marketing events are or maybe how to figure that out? I've tried: `event`, `EVENT` and combinations of `marketing-event` and others.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/crm-objects#supported-crm-object-types>
this section doesn't really seem to be useful in narrowing down the actual value options
ok, it's `marketing_event`

Thank you for reporting the challenge finding the info.

I’ve suggested to the team a doc change to make it easier to reference HubSpot defined object types via that doc.
happy to help!
Does anybody know if there is a way to copy the properties of a marketing event object from one portal to another? In my case, from production to development

You should be able to get all the marketing events  and their properties via the API then Post them to  the new portal via the API.

It does require having an app id to use the API though.

Note any associations would not carry over between the accounts as the ids for the associations would need to be the same.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/marketing-events>

<@U7SL518D6> thanks for the info. That is just at the edge of what I can do I think. Also, my developer account is limited to 10 custom properties so that might cause a ruckus as I use this more. hmm...
my short term solution is to do something like `{{ event.property || 'fallback so that I can style it' }}`

If the customer/client account you’re working with has access to the Enterprise Sandbox functionality that should help you with testing more custom properties. Alas though no syncing those properties from the sandbox to the production account currently.
So you’d still need to do the API stuff.
the workaround you’re using though sounds like it’d work well
yea, we're on enterprise...I'm not sure I've heard of enterprise sandbox functionality outside of duplicating the CRM in a sandbox
Are you referring to "sandbox accounts" or is "enterprise sandbox functionality" a unique thing?
can I send you the portal id?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/account-types#:~:text=4.%20Sandbox%20accounts%20(beta)>

It’s different from the CMS sandbox accounts you’re likely familiar with.

Basic jist is it’s intended to be like a copy of your production account that you can play around in and break stuff without worrying about affecting your real account.

There are limitations currently to what can be synced though.
should I/can I connect my "local" sandbox site to one of these sandbox accounts? that would be interesting...
oh man, that would be amazing if that works

You can connect your CLI to the sandbox. So your developer file system assets can be transferred back and forth. via CLI.

As far as connecting your CMS sandbox account to the enterprise sandbox account not directly.

Note: page content, menus, theme fields, and site settings are not currently syncable between the accounts. That said if all you need to work with is the default data in your templates, then all of that is literally just part of your files in the developer file system.
OMG, that's amazing

The reason the enterprise sandbox is better for your specific use-case most likely than a CMS sandbox, is just that it’s an account that has all of the functionality the production account has. So any limits are the same
thanks for the info, I'm going to try this now
and hopefully not destroy anything
it's suggesting I sync "themes, templates' modules" which is interesting but hopefully I'm understanding you correctly
Best part of sandboxes. It’s okay to destroy. :stuck_out_tongue:
if I don't select that, I can use the CLI to transfer the new versions of files
correct
which would end up being the templates and modules I need for testing
amazing
this is so close to solving a significant number of issues in the dev process for me!

I’m personally working on a project and what I’ve done is use the HubSpot GH actions to sync from CMS Sandbox, to Enterprise Sandbox, to production - for my site theme. So basically all pushes to my `develop` branch in GH sync to my Enterprise Sandbox, then all pushes to `main` sync to my production account.

Again there are syncing limitations right now, so page content isn’t transferred, but since I prefer to set up defaults that are close to what the live pages will actually be like, its fairly smooth.  Just have to do a small amount of duplication of work manually initially. (like matching menus and theme settings for example). Theme settings though isn’t so bad in my case as I’m building a custom theme for my specific project, I don’t really need many settings.
yea, that's amazing and a great idea
I use the HubSpot automation plugin in webpack so that should sync right to the new development sandbox
not having content sync is a slight bummer but this is still a huge step forward
I've looked at sandboxes before (and I've even used them for other stuff) but did not realize that I could use the CLI and match up files
how do you "preview" as you build stuff if you use GH actions to do the local development sync as well?

I preview like you normally do in your HubSpot account.

If I’m just making some template changes, I might use the design manager’s preview functionality. If I’m needing to really tweak a module I create a page in my CMS sandbox or enterprise sandbox to be able to mess around with the module fields and see the rendering of the module in the context of a page.
For simple things like checking that module fields look how I want, I just use the module preview in the design manager.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow>
ok, gotcha, so your CMS sandbox is setup normally and uses either watch, or webpack or whatever to push changes
do you expect content to sync eventually? this year?

Yep I dev the same way I always have. I’m using git for version control. Then when my changes are ready to go to the enterprise sandbox to see it merged with any other features being worked on, I just merge my feature branch to my `develop` branch in git and automatically it’s deployed.

Same happens if I merge from my `develop` branch to `main` except it deploys to production.
We’re aware folks want to see content syncing. I do not have a timeline I can share at this time.
but you do have a timeline... :laughing: gotcha!
:slightly_smiling_face:
I'll definitely match that setup. thanks for all the info and guidance
are "apps" safe in the sandbox environment? For example, we have a zoom integration

If you’re the sole developer working on the site you can probably skip 1 of the steps that I’m doing.

(like you could just use an enterprise sandbox, and just have the GH action deploy merges to main)
I assume it'll work if I connect it but will that cause a ruckus?
I am the sole developer now but I'm responsible for documenting and establishing a workflow for future developers

> create sandbox accounts to test functionalities without impacting your main account. For example, connect an app app to your sandbox account to test a new integration. You can sync data from your main account to test the integration and keep the data in your main account clean.
It should be safe.
that would end up syncing the "content" that I need if that indeed syncs safely
I'm a little hesitant to take on the risk of something going wrong so I probably won't do it until after the next marketing event...
but that's damn near perfect
I'm worried that Zoom will either duplicate the events or show that 0 people are attending
Has anyone ever tried the Zoom integration inside of a production site and a sandbox site? I want to be 100% that I won't cause any issues on the Zoom side of the sync
but I am really tempted to try it...

JFYI:
```Please note: integrations in your main account will not be connected automatically to the sandbox account. For any existing integrations you want to connect to a sandbox account, HubSpot recommends connecting to the sandbox version of that integration. This will help prevent disruptions to your CRM data. ```
so it's probably not a good idea

Yeah, what it’s saying there is say you have an integration that pipes data from HubSpot back to the connected app.

If you have that same app on your production account then yes any data synced from sandbox to the app integration would then sync.

That said if you use a separate account in the app you’re trying to connect or you use a developer/sandbox mode in that app you could connect that version to your HubSpot Sandbox.
